# TESS Program G04211

Title: Constraining The Low-Mass End Of The Stellar Mass Function With TESS

PI: Marocco, Federico - California Institute Of Technology

Type: SMALL

Summary: We will constrain the functional form of the low-mass end of the stellar mass function using TESS 2-min cadence data for 2666 objects within 20 pc of the Sun, 679 of which are the targets of this proposal. The light curves will be used to search for overlooked stellar and substellar companions through identification and analysis of eclipsing binaries, transiting companions, and composite light curves. By including the 679 objects proposed here to the list of 2-min cadence targets, TESS will provide 2-min cadence data for ~74% of objects within 20 pc of the Sun.
